g1yeuA0uQ38WCU78Q5W2QQ.text: I came for the Steak, I stayed for Desert.   I was craving steak, so we decided to try Wildfire. I had an 8oz Ribeye, with Mash. The Ribeye was..."OK". Just OK, really didn't live up to what it was billed as on the Menu (Aberdeen Beef). To be honest, I'd had better Steak at The Keg (Chain in Canada), which made the cost of the entree a bit hard to swallow.   However, the Desert's were sublime. We decided to take the shot-gun approach and order the Honey/Oatmeal/Whisky Ice-Cream with berries, and Chocolate Torte with salty Caramel Sauce...oh, and a single Malt from Skye. It was sublime! I waddled out of there with a very happy stomach.  Great selection of Single-Malt's for desert too!   Total was in/around 80 (pounds) for two entrees, two glasses of wine, two deserts and a single-malt. Bit overpriced, but the desert(s) really overshadowed the disappointing Steak.

8xFQMtDcg5UNeVI1E0_KyA.text: Absolutely fantastic. I had the mussels followed by a rib eye steak. My wife had the pan fried prawns, braised venison casserole and ended with the chocolate cake. Nice atmosphere and staff. Biggest tip would be to book! Seen a lot of people turned away.

eYne6RHTjQ33TFTnjeabSA.text: This was a recommendation from our hotel (Nira Caledonia - also wonderful).  We ordered a variety of dishes - soup, seafood, vegetarian, scottish pie, duck ... all were delicious.  The people are so kind as well - and made for a really memorable dinner.  I'd definitely come back and eat here on my next trip to Edinburgh.

hO5h46PTGVbOKRjVN3MdlQ.text: After a long day walking from the old town to Leith, along the waterfront, and back, I was starving -- my smartphone at the ready, I was convinced that the one thing I was craving was Scottish steak.  I didn't have a reservation, but the do-everything host and server was able to squeeze me into a gap.  It was warm and cozy within, a welcome relief from the chilly night riding on the back of a cold, grey day.  Their salmon special for the night looked delicious, as did several other items, but freshly seared moocow was on my mind, and I ordered the very reasonable steak, rare and bloody.  Now, I am a stickler for meat being cooked to the order specs.  I rarely send anything back, but I have been known to gripe, bitch, and moan when the done-ness isn't quite right.  No worries here, though: my rare steak was cooked to absolute perfection.  Pink but not cold, plenty of give, buttery in flavor even without the garlic butter I drizzled atop it, and perfect with the glass of red I needed on the side.  It does cost a bit, but compared to other steak specialists, the prices here are very reasonable, and the service is quite nice.  The wine list is decent, and the atmosphere is intimate without being stuffy.  From one carnivore to the rest, you ought to go here.

yn2epO48YizumMCYKlmLWg.text: The boyfriend and I went here for lunch on a weekday and we had a great time. Upon walking in the dining area didn't smell very good but within a few minutes the smell went away. There was such a fun mix of people in the room. Young and old, locals and tourists. We both ordered the lunch special and were so happy once our food arrived. The steaks were cooked exactly how we asked and the sides were a great addition. There beer selection  was small, but they were quality beers. The Dark Island was fantastic! I hope to go back next time I am craving a steak! The food and service were great!

jSkq7hq3tJVNDdJT4AItYg.text: Great place for meat and wine.  Cozy decor, but why cant they burn the fire at nights would do alot for the place.

XLLIAXfqke64EnHP5GJ7zg.text: We came to Wildfire on TripAdvisor recommendation, and left pleased.  We were told to expect something cosy, and it was cosy.  We were told to expect good food, and it was good food.  The service was spotty in places, but was generally right on, and our water glasses remained full!  The steaks here are really, really nice--Aberdeen cuts cooked just the right amount, served with watch-it-melt butter.  The fries on the side were generously portioned, the salad small but delicious.  Small but very nice wine selection.  Tasty but pricey desserts and dessert drinks.  It's a cosy (read: small) restaurant, with a handful of tables inside, and a handful of tables out.  Make a reservation; we saw many eager customers turned away for lack of tables.

5hbGwuFGOLwVk0Ax9ohIlg.text: Fantastic, intimate restaurant featuring modern takes on traditional Scottish dishes.  Tasty Cullen Skink (? -- fish chowder), delicious Scottish beef.  The small restaurant fills quickly -- make reservations before you go.  Seek out this spot.

Bpbm_IVewMs5yRXsKr7kdw.text: A bit pricey but a wonderful experience none the less.  Dinner reservations are highly encouraged.  We arrived to find that there was only one table available and that we needed to dine within 90 minutes due to another reservation.  Don't get me wrong the owner was very accommodating and went the extra distance seeing that we had a great time.  I would definitely recommend to others.

nVApDyMfC1ejGOlkRFGkxA.text: Have always enjoyed my meals at this little gem! It's very small, which I love. Always had a great experience. Would recommend.

D6t7laTmo_j9ToHTnwb6kg.text: Excellent food and great service. Great deals on lunch menu, highly recommend this gem.

0e6TvQXUflDq0NCk5nmuBQ.text: Had dinner here the other night and the steak was fantastic! My friend's sea bream with veggies were as well very good. We were very well serviced and drinks were flowing. The place was small but enough to accommodate a small group. We were seated immediately. I would highly recommend making reservations as the place was full and there were people coming in continuously but were requested to come back at a certain time. Some came back but it was like 9pm when a table was available. Will definitely go back again.

JmObgD1gqEJWTHPDk2SOPw.text: A really good, underrated Scottish restaurant with a cosy, homely atmosphere and great food for cheaper prices than a lot of the other Edinburgh restaurants. We regularly have our work Xmas do here.

jCX6fO3-c3xkcf0FiXd6wg.text: Prime tourist location. Very small 'cosy' restaurant. Unfussy gastropub style menu.prompt pleasing service. Chowder about 6.50, steaks about 18-25. Good value set lunch menu.Very busy pre rugby match good atmosphere

vzI0ZVCI8kCXrcQcMpplew.text: I took my fiance here when we got engaged and it was amazing! Can't fault the food at all, I had one of the best steaks I've ever eaten. The only downside is that the restaurant is so tiny and we were at the table smack bang in the middle of the room so it wasn't a very intimate experience with people going around us in all directions. However the food was divine and the service was perfect  attentive but not over the top.

Tet9QVsQ4vD7H9KPzMO_xA.text: Wildfire is a relatively new Scottish Steak and Seafood bistro and I can honestly say, the fillet steak with pepper sauce was the best I have ever had! The steak is Aberdeen Angus and cooked just the way you like it. The staff are all very friendly and professional and whilst being attentive, you never feel rushed. It is fairly small so booking is recommended, especially at the weekend. Lunch is also available and there are often lovely seasonal specials on the menu. I'm already planning my next visit.

QDWKCB2yDQwUpsaPi7Fi_g.text: Scotland's larder produces the food that is then cooked to perfection whilst being fairly priced! As a regular, I can vouch for the excellent service, seasonal menus and I recommend Wildfire to everyone I know! My favourite is well-done steak and it is often difficult to get a steak cooked that retains the flavour and moisture. At Wildfire you get exactly cooked steak, to your liking and the most flavoursome moist texture that seldom needs a sharp knife. As the daughter, granddaughter and great grandaughter of Master Butchers, I know the difference and have a very high expectation. Wildfire never disappoints. Well worth booking due to the popularity. Lunches can be two or three course for people in a hurry, but once you try the starter you'll just want more and more. Everything freshly prepared and such a wonderful choice, you too will return again and again!

Tg8PT1AhhS3kvu3lOgy82w.text: Delicious and amazing food at a crazy reasonable price considering the quality, location, and atmosphere. Recommend a reservation.

e8Dua0qAeDtHSw8ehBidSQ.text: Great place - great food and service.  It was crowded but they managed to fit us in.  Had a couple steaks - both were cooked as requested and tasted good.  Prices are reasonable.  Definitely recommend.

cKadKu-gbGtdpc3tJ48kyw.text: Very good restaurant. You will drop some coin here, but will leave with a happy palate. I ordered the tomato soup and filet. Both were wonderful. My filet was cooked to a perfect medium. They have a very nice French wine. One of my colleagues mentioned she had her best cup of coffee in all of Edinburgh here.  Great place to escape the pub food for a night.

MCPEEdZhTlndZXxroDOXWg.text: This is an fun, amazing and cozy restaurant. The steak was prepared perfectly and the quality of the entire experience was excellent. The service is very attentive and the staff don't stop moving serving and taking care of their customers. It's intimate,  not too expensive compared to other restaurants for the quality of food and service. They also accommodated food sensitivity requests easily. Next visit to Edinburgh will include a visit to Wildfire.

9CG-qoECi38YiiZnbWYO2g.text: After a 41/2 hr train trip from London we were keen to taste the local food so jumped on Yelp. We chose the Wildfire as we're keen seafood and steak lovers and the reviews were very good. We chose the smoked haddock chowder and salmon salad for starters. Both were divine, the chowder had a lovely creamy texture and the fish was mildly smoked. For mains we had surf and turf Ribeye (medium rare) with blue cheese sauce and the baked salmon. The steak was cooked perfectly and with a little bit of fat if that's how you like it. The salmon was juicy with the skin quite crispy and well seasoned. We topped it off with sticky toffee  pudding & ice cream and the whisky ice-cream- absolutely delish! Highly recommend.

gwSAdK7WdvuIczD1NiZaRQ.text: Great food, great staff, great ambience. These people love what they are doing and it shows! Recommended!

7NeeAQRq3w14Wa8F7s15Mw.text: I usually try to avoid using superlatives, but this was the best steak I have ever had, full stop. Maybe it's because I'm American or just because I looooooove me some red meat, but I am very good at eating steak. I do it a lot. And saying this was the best wasn't up for debate in my mind.   Friday evening, just got into town, having a drink with a friend and we are both craving steak. Of course I search steak in my handy dandy yelp app and Wildfire shows up. My friend tells me we would be lucky to get a table there as it's small and insanely good. She even booked it for her uni graduation a couple of years ago. I called, they had one spot open but we had to get there in 10 minutes. She wasn't kidding, it is small. They must do only 2 covers each night. We went straight for the steak mains.   I wish I had taken a picture, but I dove right in. By the end I was scared to finish because then it would be over. And I loved that medium rare ribeye so much I would have cuddled it. It comes with a bit of garlic butter, I got their special blue cheese and something or other sauce as well, and a side of garlic mushrooms. I'm salivating writing this right now. The worst part about the meal was the end because I was so forlorn that I couldn't keep eating the delectable bits of steak, the shoestring french fries, the sauce! Oh lord the sauce. The entire meal was a religious experience.   How did I spend a year in Edinburgh and not go here until I come back for a short visit?!  Go. You won't regret it. Unless you're a vegetarian. Then it might be awkward.

P8iqVsTOk6r0YO8Ea036Qw.text: Still needed a review.  Though it was a little while ago that I visited for the first time. The place hasn't changed much. I can still remember the wonderful steak and the skinny fries we were served.  It is a small place, but it will sit about 20-25 diners to capacity, it could feel a little cramped when seated in the middle.   I remember that the prices were a little high, that said, I remember eating more expensive restaurants with less tasty offerings.  Although we did had an anniversary dinner here it is not a romantic or quiet restaurant. A place near the window corner will allow you to feel a bit more private.   A solid 4 stars and a revisit is in order rather sooner than later.

iDQRa8-TiWIuJIKtkkmeQQ.text: Try this food on our last night in edinburg. We picked this restaurant randomly since it is close to our hotel. We ordered sirloin steak, fillet salmon and mussels  The food is good, the steak is tender and juicy and the salmon is fresh The mussels is tasty  Prices is ok quite reasonable for uk standard

qoDbRoQkWKQas86nt3n00w.text: I ate an amazing steak here last week. It was cooked perfectly.  The restaurant was very small and cosy, the staff were extremely friendly. To the point of being told how to pronounce Cockburn Street when ordering my taxi for me. Oops sorry about that. The only down side I must tell about is that I was sat in the middle of the room which has of course frequently brushed by the staff, that wasn't the issue however I had half of my chair on a trap door and when anyone stepped onto the door as they walked by my chair moved and this really stressed me out for the first hour, until I got a few beers in and a great steak to focus on! Although annoying it doesn't warrant losing a star in my review. Thank you for the great meal!

I0714AVtK3U8mQyBKIc0oQ.text: A tiny little restaurant, barely 10 tables and customers were turned away so make reservations. The food was very good. I had the goat cheese crostini for a starter and it was excellent! For a main, I had the Aberdeen Angus filet. Done perfectly. Very good and tender. Service was timely and friendly. A good find! I will definitely return on future trips.

photos.caption: Photo of Wildfire - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Goat cheese crostini

Oymt17jSAZPLU87XuL2FZA.text: Fantastic rib eye steaks, reasonable priced, wonderful service. This was an out of the way place we stumbled upon but we are so glad we did. WHAT A GREAT FIND!

SYHsklBCY5m0TabA8835pA.text: Dropped by near closing time as a walk-in (thank you for accommodating me). Had duck leg - It was scalding hot when it arrived, and the sauce almost sickly sweet with the heat, but with some patience it was delicious, and perfectly cooked.  Portions were very generous and the service was great. I'd come back again for sure.

B37A-ErIQVlXcklU89LGAQ.text: Wildfire is certainly a great place to go for a traditional British dinner. The Haggis for start up was nicely done and lightly presented, in contrast to the heavy contents whilst buttered mushrooms on Chrissy toasties with baby rock and The salad are tasty and fresh. Roast salmon and venison were done beautifully. A finish with a soft, light cheese cake added to the friendly and attentive staff with fabulous service. Great experience! Highly recommend to all.

photos.caption: Photo of Wildfire - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Wildfire - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Wildfire - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

MdU-SXO6nmOlxwhaL0Eblw.text: We were wandering through Edinburgh looking for a place to eat with local products and Wildfire struck our interest. I enjoyed the Salmon dinner, a special at the time, and my dinner mates enjoyed the chicken special and the ribeye steak. The whiskey ice cream is a fantastic finish to the meal. Overall it's a charming place with fantastic food.

0ttq8wd7Ytjppl7rNFLB7Q.text: I had an amazing meal here and for very reasonable prices! Granted, the reasonable prices was because I'm so used to London prices. But for a very central restaurant, the portions were generous, the food was tasty, and the bill wasn't that bad at all. Wildfire is a small Scottish restaurant just off Princes Street that specialises in meat (think Aberdeen Angus Steak) and seafood. I had the special of the day, which was a pan fried cod with vegetables in a cream sauce, which was just amazing. Dessert was good too my whisky and honey ice cream was some of the best desserts I've ever had. Definitely will be going back to Wildfire again on my next trip to Edinburgh. The London Insider london-insider.co.uk

Eq0pW5zi0XrskknlGv_s1g.text: Based on Yelp scores and that this was convenient to our hotel we sought out this restaurant. Stopped by at lunch to reserve the last opening for dinner service and we were glad we did. Steak and seafood were perfectly cooked, artfully presented and delicious. Best meal we had in a week in Edinburgh

-LVva9n3vENxnLws6AyTug.text: Only in a smaller restaurant such as Wildfire can a meal be prepared with so much individual attention. My wife enjoyed a fillet and I a ribeye both cooked perfectly. From starters to dessert each offering was delicious. That staff was very friendly. We look forward to our next visit to beautiful Edinburgh and Wildfire will surely be on the list of must does. Tim & Sharon

dDUXHZc0B54VvOXClAji9w.text: Cozy little restaurant on Rose Street. The steak was perfectly cooked and the sides were a good size. Sticky toffee pudding was perfect. Overall the service was fast and attentive, and I would definitely go back. I wish the bread was a little bit fresher though but it wasn't a deal breaker.

ws8nd5wO_ANi2xihsLNoBg.text: If you are looking for a restaurant serving traditional Scottish food, Wildfire is the place to go. Situated in Rose Street, Wildfire is right in the centre of the city and it is just around the corner from the main shopping street in Edinburgh, Princes Street, and so it is a convenient place to reach.   There is a very homely feel inside with the restaurant, with stone walls, wooden floor and a wooden burner, making it look modern and giving it a relaxed atmosphere. Wildfire's menu offer traditional Scottish dishes such as Aberdeen Angus steaks, mussels and a vast range of seafood dishes. I came here one evening with my parents for dinner and we had a lovely meal. I had the seafood chowder to start, which was absolutely amazing - it wasn't too salty which it can sometimes be, it was perfect. I then had the salmon fillet marinated in cajun spices which full of flavour and tasted really fresh - yum! My dad had the steak which he said was one of the best steaks he had ever tasted, and that is saying something!   The prices are on the whole pretty reasonable, with most starters around 6, and main courses about 15 and the steaks priced at about 20. Set lunches are available, which cost 10 for two course which is excellent value. Wildfire is a great restaurant to go to for a real taste of Scottish food.

photos.caption: Photo of Wildfire - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

KGB_uGz3wycLjVxtbpJYWQ.text: Had the 12oz Sirloin paired with the blue cheese dip, and it was beautiful. Perfectly cooked (medium rare) with a small sliver of fat on the outside. Not normally a fan of the fat but even this was cooked well, and melted in the mouth.  Girlfriend had the chicken and I was lucky enough to try a bit before she polished it off. It was amazing. Succulent, juicy and tasted as if the chicken had spent a lifetime bathing in flavour before willfully transferring itself onto the plate. She doesn't nornally finish her meals but this time round the plate was clean, that just about sums up how good this place was. Nice service too.

MrUq7DjoFWNsopmlBYa4ZA.text: My wife and I came here for our last dinner on a great trip to Edinburgh.  It did not disappoint.  I had the Cidder Skink soup for an appetizer my wife had a clam and Mussel appetizer,  both were flavorful, fresh and tasty.  We got steaks for our mains. I had the sirloin, she had the ribeye.  They were cooked just how we ordered with a rich herb butter on top.  We would've had desert if only we had room!

photos.caption: Photo of Wildfire - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. 12oz sirloin with Madh
Photo of Wildfire - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Cuddle Skink
Photo of Wildfire - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Clams, mussels and oyster appetizer

QJjlUVAryQK-dqkIx3ZM9w.text: We stumbled upon this gem whilst walking back to our hotel one eve a few weekends ago and became obsessed with it. The atmosphere was cozy and classy and the service was non-invasive but very accommodating. We tried a few things for the first time and can't wait to return one day for another go at them. The haggis was delish! It was light, not fried, and served with a lovely drambouie sauce and a shortbread cracker. It melted in our mouths and even my 7 yr old son loved it and also will  forever remember their grilled prawns! We also tried the Cullen Skink and - oh my gosh - it was sooo good!! Lastly - the homemade hot butterscotch sauce to pour over the ice cream my son had was so decadent. Thank you so much Wildfire - well done!! We can't wait to return!!

lrRFIVXM2cgNOIR1ngnDvg.text: Great small venue. Food and service were really good. Lamb shank was slow cooked to "melt in the mouth" perfection. The cheese plate was a thoughtful combination of great quality cheeses.

c6pCPGfERMcVas4VUIhFUw.text: Food was excellent, service was almost attentive. Small and cozy, but our table was not the best situated.

BXBjrIFu71Vj6OxHvnJ7tA.text: We were in town for a conference (from the states) and the restaurant was recommended.  I like to explore through food, and when we are on a trip we don't eat at the same place twice.  HOWEVER, we ate at Wildfire THREE times.  It is tiny, so it can be hard to get a table for supper, but that just means that the service is impeccable.  Not stuffy and pretentious, but caring and attentive.  I was in love!  The prawns in garlic butter sauce were absolutely divine.  The steaks were perfectly cooked and the sauces amazing.  I can't recommend this place more.  It was so good we came back multiple times!!

j6Jm8N1X8_iWCsEXwxDzGg.text: The BF and I visited Wildfire when we were traveling.  This was probably one of the best places we at the whole trip!  We had the cullen skink, haggis, Aberdeen steak, and steak and ale pie.  We also ended with the sticky toffee pudding.  All of it was incredible. The steak was one of the best we have had!   The staff was super friendly and lovely to chat with.  I highly recommend this place!

ZuEmsdrYDlidxIBX1u3EZw.text: This was my first meal in Scotland and I enjoyed it. The haggis was better than I expected, but I still enjoyed the ribeye more.   The restaurant is small so be sure to go early or make a reservation. The staff was very friendly.

SyLAj9Pj7qeHNrECH6Et_A.text: Excellent food and friendly, fast service. I had lobster gratin, ribeye and toffee dessert. Wife had lobster, prawn and avocado cocktail; fish pie and oatmeal whiskey ice cream.  Highly recommend.

jsviIZV6E0TgvvdyitnCug.text: Amazing place!! Excellent food and service!! We were visiting Edinburgh and read about this place in Yelp and what a found it was.  Specially recommend the toffee pudding as a dessert ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Wildfire - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Lunch deal - amazing mushroom, leeks and stilton soup
Photo of Wildfire - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Lunch deal - steak and frites main

kF3VKerqdpB3vf2nay-UTA.text: Definitely call for reservations.  A small (maybe 30 seats) restaurant that makes up in service and quality what it lacks in size. A friendly and hospitable ambiance and quiet enough for polite conversation with your tablemate or neighbor at the next table. The menu choices were outstanding, something for every taste.  My wife had the grilled sea bream and I had the Provencal fish stew. Both were delicious.  A very enjoyable dining experience. We will return at our next opportunity.

czRWJigop84JCUSuv1Csvw.text: Went here for our first dinner in Edinburgh and we were not disappointed! My boyfriend and I both got the fillet and shared the chocolate almond cake for dessert, and it was all delicious! The fillet was tender and moist and the garlic butter was the perfect add on. The place is super small but we were able to make a reservation same day - but make sure you do! Plenty of people were turned away because the tables were booked.

photos.caption: Photo of Wildfire - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Wildfire - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

xCNzLWQslp-u0PQbTxnWjA.text: After a stressful and rather disappointing day of travel, I decided to treat myself to a nice meal. Yelpers said this was delicious, so I decided to stop by. I didn't have a reservation, but managed to snag a seat. The waiter said that they usually keep a table for walk ins and it's based on a first come, first serve basis. I was lucky enough to be first, and watched as numerous walk ins after me got turned away.  The servers were very friendly and helpful. They didn't make me feel rushed, which is always a bonus. I ended up getting the mussels to start and the ribeye steak as my main. Both were absolutely phenomenal. I dream about them still. The mussels were in this delicious garlic and white wine sauces. Perfectly cooked and so, so, so flavourful. The exact same thing could be said about my ribeye, which was incredibly tender, melting in my mouth. It was just as good the next day as leftovers. Definitely one of the best steaks I've ever had in my life.  Absolutely wonderful place to stop in for a meal. After such good food it was impossible to feel anything but pleased with the world.

FOTSH2drufeQmDRD79ULYg.text: We could not get in the first time we tried, no reservation, came back the next night, so glad we did!! 3 of my co-workers and I had the best haggis that I've had in Edinburgh, Cullen Skink, yummy thick soup, cream Mushroom soup thick and tasty.  For main dishes we had tapas plate, amazing mussels!!! Also had duck confetti. All was great!

tg-NV8qiMHUsvn8OwL3Bhg.text: Quaint restaurant with about 40 seats, which are accounted for most of the time, suggest making reservations.  They have a daily specials board as well as a daily cheeseboard.  For starters, We ordered garlic bread with mozzarella, haggis w/oak cakes, goat cheese tart, and the mushroom fricassee.  If you trying haggis for the first time, then you chose a great place for it as their haggis appy is delicious.  Goat cheese tart with caramelized onions layered throughout is one of the best I've had.  Fricassee was equally as good.  Entrees were salmon, Aberdeen Angus ribeye, and seafood pie. Salmon was seared skin on atop a bed of green beans and snap peas.  Perfectly cooked.  Ribeye was full of flavor and also perfectly cooked.  Seafood pie was a their rendition of shepherds pie, really prepared well.  Service is great.  A great find in Edinburgh!

photos.caption: Photo of Wildfire - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Haggis
Photo of Wildfire - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Mushroom fricassee

DrhWmbmk5D4zBGePStXzdA.text: Very pleasant service and lovely food. My main course of brisket with trimmings was so impressive I forgot to photograph it. It also defeated me and I shamefully left a lot of veg. My companion was impressed by her mussels and steak too. The sticky toffee pudding was also a challenging sized portion but I beat it in the end. Come here and you surely won't be disappointed.

Y1qX2Ydb6RbzkkXtf1c9VA.text: We had a lovely dinner at Wildfire. The Mr. had a giant seafood platter and I had a steak pie. Everything was delicious. The food, the intimate space filled with twinkling lights, the service. Be sure to make reservations for this popular, small space.

mwBI1C9RjlILS9aLwufPcA.text: We had one of the best meal in Scotland here with a very friendly staff.  couldn't get in last night because they were booked for a Sunday night so we made sure to make reservation and got in  with no issues. Great classic oldies music made the environment very fun. Would come back for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Wildfire - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Our  chefs Anna, Bruce and Kristena. Bravo for a fantastic meal!
Photo of Wildfire - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. The wine suggested was perfectly paired with a meal and reasonably priced!
Photo of Wildfire - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Would you believe this beautiful fresh flowers were in the lady washroom?

bGRVK7A9R9_Wkq5kg6MUDQ.text: This is a very nice restaurant located in the new town neighborhoods.  They have a bar area with lots of whisky options, wine, and beers on tap.  They are friendly to gluten free and other dietary needs.  The standouts are their pies, which seems to be what they are known for.  Service is good and the prices seem to be reasonable compared to similar places found in more touristy areas.

8iZpIuZU9BROaENRs-hj7w.text: This is a great example of when Yelp is useless, nee a public nuisance. I'm in a city for the first time and looking for a place to eat. I have the concierges recommendations but I want to life dangerously. I search yelp for recommendations. Wildfire pops to the top with gushing quotes like , "maybe it's because im an American but the best steak of my life" etc. I assume that since I'm in Edinburgh, the second best steak of his life wasn't at Outback, and the steak may be good.  Well I was wrong. His second best steak must have been at Ponderosa. A pleasant enough atmosphere, but seriously the steak must have come from an ancient oxen that had used to plow fields for the prior decade..  Not good. Go with a legit review source not this bogus Yelp. Sometimes web 2.0 is an improvement to the status quo, e.g Wikipedia, sometimes things like restaurant reviews should be left to the experts.

photos.caption: Photo of Wildfire - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Friday night at Wildfire
